links.quantification: 40M fewer vehicle entries/year in congestion zones → 30% reduction in urban transport NOx emissions → 8K deaths/year avoided
Modal shift reduces fuel consumption by 25% in priced zones → 15 MT fuel saved/year → enables EV charging infrastructure investment
₹50K Cr/year revenue from pricing → funds 500 km new metro + 10K electric buses → transit expansion becomes self-funding
20% road space reallocation → 500 km walkable streets + 300 km protected cycle lanes → 40% increase in active mobility
Car owner resistance: 40M middle-class vehicle owners oppose pricing → political backlash risk → requires phased rollout + exemptions
Business lobby resistance: CBD parking costs → ₹2K/month per employee → companies threaten relocation → exemption pressure
Stranded parking infrastructure: ₹15L Cr invested in building parking → reduced utilization → developer opposition to mandate repeal
Pricing → modal shift to public transit → reduced road congestion → 25% faster bus speeds → more ridership → further vehicle reduction (positive feedback)
Transit revenue → better service frequency → increased ridership → TOD investment → density near stations → less car dependency (virtuous cycle)
Requires transit alternatives: Pricing only viable with 80% metro/bus coverage → infrastructure must precede pricing by 18 months
Requires pricing technology: Smart tolling + payment systems + enforcement cameras → ₹5K Cr infrastructure investment needed
Via reduced congestion: 25% faster peak-hour travel → logistics cost reduction 14% → 11% of GDP → improves competitiveness
Via transit revenue: Better bus frequency → 40% ridership increase → reduced local traffic → safer streets for children
Via emissions reduction: 30% lower NOx → reduced acid deposition → urban tree health improvement → pollinator habitat recovery
Via fuel savings: 15 MT fuel reduction → lower refinery throughput → reduced refinery emissions → regional air quality improvement
Via TOD investment: Transit accessibility premium → 20% higher real estate values near metro → drives green building certification demand
Via walkability: 40% increase in active mobility → reduced short-distance car trips → 15% reduction in hyperlocal PM2.5 hotspots
Road space reallocation → 500 km urban tree planting corridors → habitat connectivity improvement in city ecosystems
